61C5FB3679B44562AC93D1D3CF7B1E84.description: SSPF.A.11.g: draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

38DB3DDC87394E09AD476EF44E31D2AB.description: SSPF.A.11.f: gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the specific task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation

D09EA2094B6E4E61920750421DFB9BE9.description: SSPF.A.11.d: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, creating cohesion, and clarifying the relationships among complex ideas and concepts

C4C599950F8245A1B720B69DC282010F.description: SSPF.A.5.l: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by establishing and maintaining a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing

F4A772B070B34060B976D4BF20040F56.description: SSPF.A.5.k: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by using words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, creating cohesion, and clarifying the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims

01425745ED1B44ADA447D717A4A90B2E.description: SSPF.A.5.j: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by introducing precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establishing the significance of the claim(s), distinguishing the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and creating an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence

9FA69539F88E49C2980ACABDC36A0437.description: SSPF.A.5.i: by the end of grade 12, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 11-12 text complexity band independently and proficiently

75C5695780154131AE5D609C84CD19AE.description: SSPF.A.5.h: integrate information from diverse sources, both primary and secondary, into a coherent understanding of an idea or event, noting discrepancies among sources

5FF67141743943A1B29936992828F443.description: SSPF.A.5.g: evaluate an author's premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information

5A65294501C34CD08661D568E5EE8F0C.description: SSPF.A.5.f: integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem

90FC03D4096C43B29038DC8A7A39F750.description: SSPF.A.5.e: evaluate authors' differing points of view on the same historical event or issue by assessing the authors' claims, reasoning, and evidence

257648555FCE4CDFB0554B850154F636.description: SSPF.A.5.d: analyze in detail how a complex primary source is structured, including how key sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text contribute to the whole

3E7E23F12CD5409AB78C8CCF2D08606E.description: SSPF.A.5.c: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including analyzing how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term over the course of a text

7E831C509EB7402F8EA04FF5C2133418.description: SSPF.A.5.b: determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary that makes clear the relationships among the key details and ideas

F90FAA7228544636A178F35B0BC63AD7.description: SSPF.A.5.a: cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, connecting insights gained from specific details to an understanding of the text as a whole

1A7D2D540CB142D8BA9D98813A0D87C2.description: SSPF.A.5: identify social studies reference resources to use for a specific purpose

5A5C8BF885684784858CCA1C946E9737.description: SSPF.A.4.q: write routinely over extended time frames (i.e., time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (i.e., a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences

2303E199ECEF4B85B88E439F7ABF8214.description: SSPF.A.4.p: draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

5A2667ED40A942FD921EEF3844687052.description: SSPF.A.4.o: gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the specific task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation

F77E96A0CEE44B2586FD2061C1AE53DA.description: SSPF.A.4.n: conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

099E9836DB8B4B4EA80434B4A54A53C9.description: SSPF.A.4.m: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information

4B94A7FDCB2443508B833535697B4F1D.description: SSPF.A.4.l: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using precise language, domain-specific vocabulary and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic; conveying a knowledgeable stance in a style that responds to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers

6A1204EB4F0040F580BC801892C1462F.description: SSPF.A.4.k: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, creating cohesion, and clarifying the relationships among complex ideas and concepts

3BD2A3A426F2449CBDDD1DB2831ED29F.description: SSPF.A.4.j: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by developing the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic

812F61B649944B38A35FF043394D0FC2.description: SSPF.A.4.i: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by introducing a topic and organizing complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; including formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension

E0EB6F70B6204FAEA859C2FE919D6FB5.description: SSPF.A.4.h: by the end of grade 12, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 11-12 text complexity band independently and proficiently

AB703FF31DFA40D291474D41400A4719.description: SSPF.A.4.g: integrate information from diverse sources, both primary and secondary, into a coherent understanding of an idea or event, noting discrepancies among sources

5B817D663136405F8933E245D2C81BD2.description: SSPF.A.4.f: evaluate an author's premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information

FD6697D6B47B4557B2EC9D1020D14C2B.description: SSPF.A.4.e: integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem

1EA69077F7BF4A70AF7E114ED4E9061D.description: SSPF.A.4.d: analyze in detail how a complex primary source is structured, including how key sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text contribute to the whole

4790F44043144B2BAED99191F57B81D1.description: SSPF.A.4.c: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including analyzing how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term over the course of a text

1ED7F2D216BF4783B406F3018934CCDF.description: SSPF.A.4.b: determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary that makes clear the relationships among the key details and ideas

D13867FAAC724E9BBB7B0D2AC995D5C6.description: SSPF.A.4.a: cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, connecting insights gained from specific details to an understanding of the text as a whole

DAC33B3E7E1A42139783DC4F6F28C57D.description: SSPF.A.4: identify and use primary and secondary sources

F08AF63A819641A7B115B4AEF04F09EE.description: SSPF.A.3.i: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information

9A561461940E4CA7B16B35BA7DD250E9.description: SSPF.A.3.h: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

B6134BD81E4F48A6AAD97C7E8A0931F5.description: SSPF.A.3.g: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

9172A374E8E84D9CB65AAD3D75556AC5.description: SSPF.A.3.f: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

5CB30411ABB24484979FAF0381D1A97F.description: SSPF.A.3.e: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by developing claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form that anticipates the audience's knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases

58E5975A9BFB4B49BD65AD8414FB8A5E.description: SSPF.A.3.d: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by introducing precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establishing the significance of the claim(s), distinguishing the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and creating an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence

FEAFE620519B437789A0ADA587C37B6F.description: SSPF.A.3.c: integrate information from diverse sources, both primary and secondary, into a coherent understanding of an idea or event, noting discrepancies among sources

6D27BEA997434591B36EAE304E630754.description: SSPF.A.3.b: evaluate an author's premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information

6CB084A324AF4D1CB33AFFF505817595.description: SSPF.A.3.a: integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem

7B02287DF626435893699E8D147A670F.description: SSPF.A.3: distinguish between fact and opinion as used in informational/explanatory text

ADCB1C5046CB4BC6ACA6C16E7220BAD7.description: SSPF.A.2.f: conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

779469CE73FD45EF80EB50EF44518949.description: SSPF.A.2.e: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information

C65E481774E44D7896C32BDDE0B0B7B5.description: SSPF.A.2.d: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

324F6D81A46D494A9F3AA6BED549261B.description: SSPF.A.2.c: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

FD4589D9E05D4A76A2E4245513BA2CDE.description: SSPF.A.2.b: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

E5092DBB116747E0A68F2DCAD13DBA65.description: SSPF.A.2.a: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented

9648015A54804958B8BA952A4C10DE62.description: SSPF.A.2: identify and write about issues and/or problems and alternative solutions

1AD1631F9A9F492CA1DBA5F6E20F0C7C.description: SSPF.A.1.d: conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

EDD0B430C2BD49189D73778F89EE9F32.description: SSPF.A.1.c: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

237C2AFCAC9D4141B0F403F332D68224.description: SSPF.A.1.b: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by developing claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form that anticipates the audience's knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases

449D5E0422CC490B8CF55DB815F5D563.description: SSPF.A.1.a: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by introducing precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establishing the significance of the claim(s), distinguishing the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and creating an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence
